thread.title_full: Fearne Cotton sports 'True love' themed jacket for | Daily Mail Online

author: Mail Online Reporter
title: Fearne Cotton sports 'True love' themed jacket for | Daily Mail Online
text: Share 170 shares Black lace up biker boots teamed with blue jeans added to the look while Fearne wore her blonde hair in a sleek parted style. The star appeared to have arrived on a motorbike and was aided by a male companion who helped her unload her bags. Text for success: Fearne clutched her mobile phone as she strolled along Biker chic: Fearne was aided by a male companion after arriving on her bike Coordination: She teamed the coat with blue jeans and a bright red jumper dress with a matching scarlet shoulder bag Edgy: Black lace up biker boots teamed with blue jeans added to the look while Fearne wore her blonde hair in a sleek parted style Fearne earlier posted a Valentine's Day Instagram of herself with her two-year-old son Rex, alongside the caption: 'Valentines snugs with Rex (although he is shouting GET OFF MUM)' The presenter's appearance came just days after she appeared on TV's Lorraine to discuss her new book Happy, revealing a previous battle with depression. Revealing that she had to take anti-depressants for a time, she said: 'I was really really unhappy, but during that period I learned so much.' It's love! Fearne has been happily married to rocker Jesse Wood for two years Candid: The presenter's appearance came just days after she appeared on TV's Lorraine to discuss her new book Happy, revealing a previous battle with depression Sharing stories: Fearne's new tome explores 'finding joy in every day' 'My whole perspective changed. I came out of the fog. I thought, "OK. What information can I share from this?" 'I haven't completely got it sussed. But when you're open about things, that's when you dispel the myths and the taboos.' Lorraine agreed: 'We're all just struggling through.' Looking at the positives, mother-of-two Fearne, who is married to Jesse Wood, said happiness can come in the simplest of ways. She said: 'My book isn't a guide and doesn't really have tips, but I've shared things that have happened to me.' Cuddling up: Fearne posted a cute snapshot of herself snuggling up to her two-year-old son Rex on Tuesday morning Share or comment on this article 170
